page.title: 04Life in the Camp area
page.content: Miss Hall has lived in the Camp area since March 4th 1910. She has always lived in the same house. There were 9 children in her family. Her father worked at Hill End Brickfields, he dug up clay. Miss Hall said it was very lonely when she first came here and that there were country lanes and few houses. She and her brothers and sisters came to Camp School. Where Mrs Soud's shop is now there was a small sweet shop and Mrs White lived there. She had 18 children. Opposite the school there was a baker's, called Parsons. They made their own cakes and bread and sold sweets. A milk cart came round with 2 big urns. The milk was ladled into your jug; it cost 3d a pint. After her mother died Miss Hall did all the housework and looked after her baby sister who was 6 months old. The children made up their own games.
